msContents.summary:
This is a multitext manuscript. There are three different texts but there is a theme. All the three texts describe the auspicious place specially the holy mountain, as the titles suggests Girimahātmya. Numbering of all these three texts is separate. Numbering of every text starts with 1 except the last text Satyagirimahātmya. The first folio of the Satyagirimahātmya is not numbered. There is a blank folio after the completion of the Yādavagirimāhatmya and beginning of the Śvetagirimahātmya. All these texts are not available in the available published editions of the Nāradīyapurāṇa or Brahmāṇḍapurāṇa. On III-
something is written in Sanskrit in Grantha script. Ceṭṭalūr is a name of a village from Kerala.

handNote.desc:
The hand writing is clear and clean except some places it is scrawled. The
folio of the third text has some matter written in Sanskrit and Grantha script. According to the colophon all the three texts are written by some scribe named Śrinivāsan.

origin.origDate:
The Yādavagirimāhatmyam is copied approximately between 1900-1901 in the Month of Magha (January) on the 11th day by Śrīnivāsan.
The Śvetagirimāhātmyam is copied approximately between 1900-1901 in the Month of Mārgaśīrṣa (January) on the 13th day by Śrīnivāsan. The Satyagirimāhātmyam is copied approximately between 1901-1902 in the Month of Mārgaśīrṣa (January) on the 2nd day by Śrīnivāsan from Ceṭṭalūr.
